item.title: Ronapreve: 'Most vulnerable' to get new Covid drug next week
item.description: Antibody therapy Ronapreve, given to Donald Trump, will be given to eligible NHS patients in hospital.

item.title: Covid calculator spots people vulnerable despite jabs
item.description: An online tool could help doctors identify those who would benefit from boosters or early therapy.

item.title: Long Covid less common than feared - ONS study
item.description: One in 40 people has some long-lasting symptoms, Office for National Statistics data suggests.

item.title: Women threatened over maternity care bills
item.description: A debt collection company told some women that future visas for in the UK would be refused if they did not pay.

item.title: First Covid booster jabs given to NHS staff
item.description: Hospitals in England and Wales can now start vaccinating healthcare workers with a booster dose.

item.title: Cawston Park: Hospital owner defends its residential homes
item.description: The former operator of Jeesal Cawston Park says an inquiry's findings do not apply to its homes.

item.title: Military to be called in to help Scottish ambulance crews
item.description: A series of serious ambulance delays have emerged, including one where a man died after a 40-hour wait.

item.title: Call for investigation of menstrual changes after Covid jabs
item.description: There is no evidence of any impact on fertility - but research will help to counter false claims.

item.title: Covid: Plan B would be triggered by NHS pressure, Sajid Javid says
item.description: Government scientists are warning of a jump in Covid hospital admissions if rules are not tightened soon.

item.title: Alex Echo: Artist reveals 'shock' over Parkinson's diagnosis
item.description: Alex Echo has been forced to give up most of his painting work, but is now championing digital art.

item.title: Covid booster vaccine rollout to begin across UK next week
item.description: Experts say a single dose of Pfizer should be offered at least six months after a second dose.

item.title: Parents warn of tsunami of school-anxiety cases
item.description: Cases of crippling school anxiety preventing attendance are spiralling, support groups say.

item.title: Covid jab rollout for 12 to 15-year-olds to start in UK schools
item.description: Parental consent is sought for the programme for children aged 12 to 15-year-olds.

item.title: Covid: Single jab recommended for 12 to 15-year-olds by UK's top doctors
item.description: Move will help reduce school disruption, top doctors say, with decision now in hands of ministers.

item.title: Covid deaths rare among fully vaccinated - ONS
item.description: Out of 51,000 Covid deaths in England between January and July, only 256 occurred after two doses.

item.title: Covid: Colchester Institute students board bus to get jabbed
item.description: A vaccination bus is on campus to give teenagers a chance to get jabbed.

item.title: Galleri cancer test: What is it and who can get it?
item.description: Volunteers are being recruited in England for a blood test able to detect more than 50 types of cancer.

item.title: NHS sparks pride but one in five go private, survey finds
item.description: The charity Engage Britain polled more than 4,000 British adults on their attitudes to the NHS.

item.title: Covid: More than 300,000 suspected of breaking quarantine rules
item.description: It comes as the prime minister prepares to announce his winter Covid plan, including for booster jabs.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... why people are using a horse drug
item.description: Ivermectin is being used by some to treat Covid-19, despite the benefits being unproven.

item.title: Covid: Which countries are vaccinating children and why?
item.description: Millions of children around the world are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19: How a Norwich care home is preparing for autumn and winter
item.description: How are care home staff and residents preparing to face a second autumn and winter of Covid-19?

item.title: What difference will jabbing young teens make?
item.description: How to weigh the pros and cons of a vaccine for a disease that is rarely serious in young people.

item.title: Covid origin: US spy agencies publish 'inconclusive' report
item.description: The office that oversees US spy agencies could not establish how the coronavirus pandemic began.

item.title: Covid: Delta variant patients twice as likely to need hospital care
item.description: Get double-jabbed to reduce this risk, advise experts who have studied different variants of the virus.

item.title: Social care charges: Disabled and vulnerable adults hit by steep rises
item.description: Many are facing a significant rise in the money they have to pay towards the support they receive.

item.title: High Street chemists to offer free blood pressure checks
item.description: The NHS initiative, for people in England over the age of 40, could save thousands of lives.

item.title: Covid: People are vaccinated - so why are there so many cases?
item.description: More than four out of five UK adults are now fully vaccinated, but daily case rates remain high.

item.title: Why bonding over the Euros appeared to increase Covid cases in men
item.description: Psychologists say men need to be part of a group in order to vent their feelings and emotions.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: All children aged 12-15 across the UK will be offered one dose of the Pifzer vaccine.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Face coverings could become a legal requirement in England again if the NHS struggles this winter.

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-12s in the UK will be able to get at least one Covid jab.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid rules: What's in England's 'Winter Plan'?
item.description: Lockdown rules have changed across the UK, but some restrictions remain in place.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: Ros Atkins On… the ethics of Covid booster jabs
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at the ethics of Western countries rolling out Covid booster jabs while millions globally remain unvaccinated.

item.title: ‘The green gym has pulled me out of a rut’
item.description: Gardening is being offered as an alternative for some to lifting weights and running on treadmills.

item.title: Sickle cell: 'Did our son have to die to change things?'
item.description: It's the fastest-growing genetic condition in the UK but some feel the illness, which mostly affects black people, isn't taken seriously.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: The Wanted's Tom Parker opens up about his cancer diagnosis
item.description: Tom refuses to let cancer dominate his life after being diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour.
